metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.code_html:
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      counter: 0
    }
  },
  renderTracked(evt) {
    console.log("renderTracked: ",evt);
    alert("renderTracked");
  }
}

content.text: The renderTracked hook runs when a render function is set to track, or monitor, a reactive component.
content.html: The renderTracked hook runs when a render function is set to track, or monitor, a reactive component.

content.text: The renderTracked hook usually runs when a reactive component is initialized, because that is when the Vue's automatic reactive system is set up.
content.html: The renderTracked hook usually runs when a reactive component is initialized, because that is when the Vue's automatic reactive system is set up.

content.text: A reactive component is a component that changes.
content.html: A reactive component is a component that changes.

content.text: A render function is a function compiled by Vue that keeps track of reactive components. When a reactive component changes, the render function is triggered and re-renders the application to the screen.
content.html: A render function is a function compiled by Vue that keeps track of reactive components. When a reactive component changes, the render function is triggered and re-renders the application to the screen.

content.text: The renderTracked hook is meant to be used in debugging, and is only available in development mode.
content.html: The renderTracked hook is meant to be used in debugging, and is only available in development mode.
